result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle M Tyacke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,150.00 payable to North Shore Bank located at 9131 W. Oklahoma Avenue.  Joint and several with codefendant Christa Williams 15CF2345.  Restitution to be paid prior to any Court costs, fees and assessments.

Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments. 
RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:   To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Mental health assessment.  Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with North Shore Bank and Susan K.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle M Tyacke

records.addlTxt: Per order dated January 17, 2020, Appeal No. 2020XX57-CR (2015CF2344, 2015CF2368), IT IS ORDERED that the court will take no action on the letter described above.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 10, for review. jbs
on count 2.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing SEPTEMBER 23, 2015 received and filed. (39 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to PAUL OBERER.
The court reporter on the plea date of 8-20-2015 was incorrectly entered.   Change made to reflect the correct court reporter.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by Timothy D.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 123 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $2,150.00 payable to North Shore Bank located at 9131 W. Oklahoma Avenue, joint and several with co-defendant Christa Williams 15CF2345.  Restitution to be paid prior to any court costs, fees and assessments.  Restitution are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with North Shore Bank and Susan K. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in custody.  Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Danielle M Tyacke not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled Plea and Sentencing.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, Defendant Danielle M Tyacke not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NORTH SHORE BANK (ANY BRANCH) AND CO-DEF:  CHRISTA WILLIAMS.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
